brewery.name: Cabarrus Brewing Company
brewery.description:
Cabarrus Brewing Company is the first full-scale craft brewery in Concord and Cabarrus County, NC. We strive to meld local history, character and traditions with locally produced craft beer!

Located in Concord’s historic Gibson Mill, the brewery is housed in a building that was once the finished goods warehouse for the Gibson Manufacturing Company and served as a vital part of Cannon Mills Plant 6.

The 15 barrel three vessel brewhouse is the heart of the facility with the entire production area being visible from throughout the 5,000 square foot taproom. The Tap Room has an open and expansive bar area, several large tv screens, streaming and occasional live music, along with ample seating. It's the perfect place to relax, socialize and enjoy a variety of artfully crafted beers.

In addition, when the weather permits our outdoor patio space is opened expanding the tap room significantly into the great outdoors. 

An open mezzanine level overlooks the entire facility which offers a great view looking down right into the brewing area. The Mezzanine is available for private events, corporate meetings and special functions of varying sizes.

We look to partner with and distribute to local restaurants and venues. We offer multiple beer styles ranging from a light pilsner to a hearty stout, with seasonal offerings and special craft creations as well. Cabarrus Brewing is proud to celebrate Cabarrus County and all its history….textiles, agriculture, mining, motorsports….and our beers' names have ties to that rich and storied history. We look forward to having you try Cabarrus County’s own craft beer and are excited to host you soon and often!

brewery.name: Starpoint Brewing
brewery.description: Nestled in the pine forests of Carrboro NC, Starpoint Brewing is bringing the freshest and best tasting ales and lagers to the locals. We are looking forward to serving the triangle and beyond!!!

brewery.name: Bull City Ciderworks
brewery.description: Join us for flights, pints and growlers of refreshingly unique, modern American cider at the Triangle's first cider bar!  Small batch and special seasonal ciders can only be found on tap at the cider bar.  The front lot is filled with picnic tables and bar games!  As always, friendly dogs are welcome!

brewery.name: Haw River Farmhouse Ales
brewery.description: Haw River Farmhouse Ales will handcraft traditional French- & Belgian-style ales with a little southern flair, using local and organic ingredients where possible in each of our beers. Located in Saxapahaw, NC, opening Memorial Day Weekend, 2012.

brewery.name: Bad Bishop Brewing

brewery.name: Bombshell Beer Company
brewery.description:
Bombshell Beer Company’s 5,840 sq. ft building is conveniently located in the heart of Holly Springs within the Omni business park located off N.Main St. The building will house the production brewery, lab and a 1400 sq. ft. tasting room.
Our brewery features a custom designed 15 BBL steam fired brewhouse manufactured by SMT Food and Beverage Systems of Stokesdale NC. Our equipment is crafted by US workers and made of US stainless steel, a key factor of why we selected SMT as our equipment manufacturer. Supporting American workers and American Industry was important to the Bombshell founders.
Bombshell’s brewhouse features a two vessel system consisting of a mash tun complete with rakes and steam jacket for step infusion mashing and a combination brew kettle/whirlpool. A thirty barrel hot liquor tank and dual stage high efficiency plate and frame heat exchanger round out Bombshell’s brewhouse system. Initially two 15BBL and one 30BBL multi zone jacketed fermentation vessels and a 30BBL bright tank will be utilized in the production of Bombshell’s high quality, craft beers.
We will showcase our hand-crafted beers to the public in a new 1400 sq. ft. tasting room scheduled opening is which is planned to be open to visitors in July. The tasting room will offer sample flights, pints, and beer to go in growlers and kegs. Brewery tours and private event programs will also be available.
Bombshell Beer is owned by Ellen Joyner, Michelle Miniutti and Jackie Hudspeth.

brewery.name: Thirty Three Brewing Co.
brewery.description: 33 Brewing high performance artisan beers, hand crafted right here in Race City USA, Mooresville NC. A former NASCAR Sprint cup series fabricator and Jackman, taking my love of home brewing and beer, sharing it with the world! We are aiming for a late spring/early summer 2016 opening. Thank you for your patience.

brewery.name: Yellow Sun Brewing Co
brewery.description: We are a husband and wife owned microbrewery located in Rutherfordton NC (just an hour east of Asheville, aka beer mecca!).

brewery.name: American Honor Beer Company
brewery.description: Our classical revolutionary heroes including Henry, Franklin, Jefferson, and Washington set forth a paradigm to enable American prosperity and the creation of the greatest civilization in history. At American Honor Beer Company, our brews serve as a rallying point for those who cherish and commemorate America’s founding principles. General Liberty raises a toast to each and every American who honors the individual's natural rights to life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness.

brewery.name: Twenty-Six Acres Brewing Company
brewery.description: High Performance Brewing

brewery.name: Appalachian Mountain Brewery
brewery.description:
The Appalachian Mountain Brewery (AMB) is a craft brewery located in the heart of North Carolina’s High Country. Home of the Appalachian State Mountaineers, Boone has countless outdoor activities at your fingertips: rock climbing, hiking, biking, kayaking, skiing, snowboarding, and more! AMB supplies fresh, flavorful beer to the High Country, while maintaining a strong emphasis on both sustainable values and the local community.

Although our craft is beer, AMB is much more than a brewery. Our founding principles go well beyond the pint glass and focus on ideals that strive to empower individuals, support local enterprise, and give back to the greater Appalachian region.  This can best be summarized in our motto:  ”Act Local. Drink Local.”

We will set a new precedent within the brewing industry through an intimate knowledge of the science behind sustainability and a strong desire to improve the current status quo in the field.  We will utilize photovoltaic solar panels, native rain gardens and wetlands, rain water harvesting, and local farm collaboration. Through these efforts AMB will make the highest quality beer while maintaining the highest quality of respect for not only the local community but also the planet at large.

Act Local. Drink Local.

brewery.name: 1789 Brewery & Taphouse
brewery.description:
With a focus on quality over quantity, we will use the finest ingredients available to produce an exceptional product. All of our beer is handcrafted with care and held to the highest standards.

Flavorful, refreshing, unfiltered deliciousness created fresh for you to enjoy straight from the source. The beers in our Signature Collection are classic styles, rooted in European tradition, crafted with American flair. The line-up includes, but is not limited to, an American IPA, a Tart Gose or Berliner Wiesse, an English Pale Ale, an Irish Stout, a German Golden Lager, a Czech Dark Lager, a Belgian Wit, and a Hefeweizen.

We plan to have 6 of our Signature Collection beers on tap at all times, but we also love experimenting with new flavors and brewing fun, eccentric beers. A constant rotation of seasonal specialties, barrel-aged projects, collaborations, and experimental batches of our own will be among the 20 different choices featured in the 1789 Taphouse.

It is important for us to host a wide variety of local and international guest taps, so we always have an appealing beverage available for everyone. Hard cider, kombucha, sparkling soda, and cold-pressed coffee will also be on hand for gluten-free and alcohol-free options.

brewery.name: Nickelpoint Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Nickelpoint Brewing Co. is a craft brewery located in the Five Points neighborhood of Raleigh, North Carolina, that will offer classic European style ales. A 20 bbl microbrewery with a tasting room is being up-fitted where customers will be able to enjoy the brewery's beers and learn about the process of brewing. Stay thirsty and stay tuned for a 2014 opening!

brewery.name: Burlington Beer Works
brewery.description:
We are Burlington’s co-op brewery and restaurant located in the historic downtown. We believe that a strong community is built around engaged businesses that give back to their community and that there is no better model than the co-op for this purpose. Our owners are not just owners of a brewery and restaurant; they are also owners of an engine driving the revitalization of Burlington.

As a brewery, we are founded around the idea of “truly local” beer. We will source our beer recipes and inspiration through partnerships with East of Elon Home Brewing Cooperative and other local home and professional brewers. We take an active role in supporting the culture and expansion of home brewing through events at our brewery. All of our Burlington Beer Works beers will be crafted locally, brewed on site, and only available at our restaurant.

As a restaurant, we believe that sustainable, local, and responsibly sourced food should be available to everyone at a reasonable price. Our menu will fluctuate with the ebb and flow of the seasons. Our members are also our test-kitchen. From them we will draw the inspiration for our ever-evolving menu.

brewery.name: Craggie Brewing Company
brewery.description: Our passion is to locally produce quality craft beers and to foster community involvement with commitment and integrity.

brewery.name: BearWaters Brewing Company
brewery.description: BearWaters Brewing Company is located in Waynesville North Carolina in the beautiful Smoky Mountains of Western North Carolina. BearWaters was named in honor of the region's pristine source of mountain water. BearWaters captures the spirit, traditions and majesty of the Great Smoky Mountains. Come enjoy what happens when fearless creativity, maticulous brewing meets natures greatest natural resource.

brewery.name: Winding Creek Brewing Co
brewery.description: We are a Tap room, Music Hall,and eventually a Brewery. We hope to have the Tap Room & Music hall open in Mid to late March featuring rotating taps from breweries from across the Carolinas, and great local and regional music. We are etimatinmg the brewery will be producing in June or July and we will then replace most of the guest taps to our native pours. Come meet with your friends, play a game, hear some music, and enjoy some great beer.

brewery.name: Roth Brewing Company
brewery.description: Founded in December of 2008, this company has been working hard to develop beers that can take the world by storm. Before there was a Roth Brewing Company, the guys started as most new breweries do, with homebrewing. After hearing endless rave reviews of their beers, they decided to jump in head first and open this amazing company. It might be said that prophecies were fulfilled on the day that they took up brewing, but only time shall tell..

brewery.name: Heinzelmännchen Brewery
brewery.description:
In a microbrewery in downtown Sylva, NC, German-born brewmaster Dieter Kuhn and his wife Sheryl Rudd are creating light and refreshing German beer made with wholesome grains, fresh hops & no preservatives. All beers are keg conditioned and non-filtered, making them smooth and lighter in body.
Enjoy pints or flights in our taproom then take home your favorite in one of our unique, German 2-liter growlers. We have snacks available and you are welcome to bring in food from local restaurants (some will deliver) or your picnic!

brewery.name: York Chester Brewing Company
brewery.description: YCBC is an exciting and new upcoming nano brewery in Belmont, NC. Look for us to open late summer/early fall 2016!

brewery.name: Heist Brewery
brewery.description: It’s going down right now. There’s a Heist happening in Charlotte. Except at this robbery everybody’s going to get their share of the loot, er…brew. After over two years of planning, Charlotte will now be called home to the Heist Brewery.

brewery.name: Starrlight Mead
brewery.description:
After several years as home mead makers, we are thrilled to be opening Starrlight Mead. We have had a fantastic time making mead and meeting mead drinkers from all over the world, and now its our turn to share our love of mead with all of you!

Becky Starr, Owner, Sales/Tasting Room Manager
Ben Starr, Owner, Wine/Meadmaker

We first discovered mead in CA at the Southern California Renaissance Pleasure Faire. Several years later, we found friends that were home brewing mead with good results. We decided to try our hand at it too.

In February 2006, we entered our first competition and took Best in Show out of over 210 entries in the home mead-maker category at the International Mead Association’s Mead Festival. The competition was judged by seven professionals in the mead industry; including Ken Schramm, author of The Compleat Mead Maker, and meadery owners from around the world. The Best in Show prize was selected from the gold medal winners in nine categories. Our “Starrlight Mulled Apple Cyser” was awarded not only the gold medal in the cyser (mead made with apples) category, but was also selected as the best overall representation of mead making. It was at that point we decided to try creating a business from our love of mead.

Ben shares his expertise and love of brewing by conducting demonstrations and workshops on mead making in the local community. We also organize and conduct the local Mead Day celebration each August (since 2005) and are a key part of the product tasting team for mead reviews on Gotmead.com. Becky worked with Chatham Hill Winery for 2 years learning tasting room and wine club management. We are members of the Chatham County Beekeepers Association, and the NC Winegrowers Association.

brewery.name: Currahee Brewing Co
brewery.description: Purveyors of delicious, European-influenced ales and lagers produced in Franklin, North Carolina

brewery.name: OysterHouse Brewing Company
brewery.description: The Oyster House is a small micro brewery devoted to producing high quality, unique ales for beer and seafood lovers.

brewery.name: Lazy Hiker Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Deep in the mountains of North Carolina, just off the Appalachian Trail, sits Franklin, NC. In the old Town Hall on the end of Main Street we're crafting beer and community that's fresh and honest. Untie your boots and enjoy the view - no matter how hard you hiked to get there.

brewery.name: Highland Brewing Company
brewery.description: Highland Brewing Company began in the basement of Barley's Taproom in downtown Asheville, North Carolina in 1994. Through the years the company has grown from a three person operation to a staff of almost 50, from about 4,000 to 35,000 square feet, and from a capacity to brew 2,000 barrels annually to almost 40,000. Those of you who saw the old brewery may remember the retrofitted dairy equipment we used. We held on to two of those tanks in our move to the East Asheville location. Alongside them, we have new fermentation and brite beer tanks to go with our 50-barrel brew house. Our pilot brew house is a brewer's playground for developing new seasonal beers, high gravity brews, and whatever else the brewers dream up. Highland currently supplies both Carolinas, Georgia, Tennessee, Florida, Alabama, Ohio, Kentucky and Virginia. Thanks for your support!

brewery.name: Wise Man Brewing
brewery.description: 15 BBL craft brewery and taproom in Downtown Winston-Salem. We've created an urban industrial atmosphere with a laid back, community vibe that makes people want to get off the couch and gather together to enjoy the great invention that is beer. Come share a pint with us!
